org.fishwife.jrugged.interval

Class DiscreteInterval

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fishwife.jrugged.interval.DiscreteInterval

  • public class DiscreteInterval
extends Object
    Representation of integer (long) intervals and associated arithmetic. This is useful for representing numbers with inherent measurement error or uncertainty; instead of a single value or a single value with a +/- error, we represent this as a range of values. One of the interesting properties of interval arithmetic is that errors are monotonically nondecreasing as you perform additional operations on them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DiscreteInterval(long min, long max)
      Creates an interval spanning a range between the two provided value arguments, inclusive.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiscreteInterval

        public DiscreteInterval(long min,
                        long max)
        Creates an interval spanning a range between the two provided value arguments, inclusive. Order matters for the arguments due to wraparound overflow of longs; the range is defined as all the values crossed by starting at 'min' and then incrementing until 'max' is reached. Thus, this is the closed interval [min, max].
        Parameters:
        min - minimum value of range
        max - maximum value of range
